chat.welcomeSub: Send a message to get started.
chat.placeholder: Type a message... or ask Guenther what he can do

info.description: Open-source AI agent with MCP tool support, self-hosted via Docker.
info.disclaimerText1: This software is provided without any warranty. Use it entirely at your own risk.
info.disclaimerText2: The author accepts no liability whatsoever â€” neither for direct nor indirect damages, data loss, security incidents, costs incurred through third-party API usage (OpenRouter, OpenAI, etc.), damages from AI-generated content, or faulty tool executions.
info.disclaimerText3: Set spending limits on API keys. Do not enter sensitive data in chats. Do not expose the software publicly without authentication.

general.defaultProviderHelp: Which provider is used by default for chat
general.selectModel: â€” Select model from list â€”
general.modelHelp: e.g. openai/gpt-4o, anthropic/claude-3.5-sonnet, llama3.2 â€” depends on provider
general.temperatureHelp: Determines how creative / unpredictable the responses are
general.timeoutHelp: Maximum wait time for LLM responses â€” increase for slow local models (default: 120s)
general.useWhisper: Use OpenAI Whisper for speech recognition (STT)
general.whisperHelp: Uses whisper-1 â€” more reliable than OpenRouter for audio

agents.description: Agents have their own system prompt. When starting a new chat, you can select an agent.
agents.name: Name

autoprompts.description: Autoprompts run automatically at scheduled times. The result is saved in a dedicated chat in the history.
autoprompts.name: Name
autoprompts.saveToChatDesc: Disabled: agent runs silently (e.g. Telegram only). Enabled: result is saved in a dedicated chat in the history.
autoprompts.promptPlaceholder:
e.g. Give me a summary of today's news and send it via Telegram to @mama75.

(Note: The recipient must have messaged the bot at least once before, otherwise Telegram won't allow it.)

providers.description: All providers are OpenAI API-compatible. No API key needed for Ollama and LM Studio.
providers.name: Name
providers.baseUrlHelp: Ends with /v1 â€” /chat/completions is appended automatically
providers.apiKeyHelp: Only fill in to change the stored key
providers.testOk_one: âœ“ Connection OK â€” {{count}} model found
providers.testOk_other: âœ“ Connection OK â€” {{count}} models found
providers.sshDesc: If {{label}} is running on your local machine, you can make it accessible to the server via SSH reverse tunnel. Run this command on your local machine:
providers.sshUrlTitle: While the tunnel is active, enter this as the base URL:
providers.sshNote: host.docker.internal points from the container to the server host where the SSH tunnel is listening. -N opens the tunnel only without a shell. For a persistent tunnel, autossh is recommended.
providers.sshPrereqDesc: For the reverse tunnel to work, /etc/ssh/sshd_config on the server must contain:
providers.sshRestartDesc: GatewayPorts yes is needed so the forwarded port is not only accessible on 127.0.0.1 of the server but also from the Docker container. Then restart the SSH service:

tools.description: Per tool you can override the provider and model. If the override is set, it will be used for that tool.

mcp.description: External MCP servers are connected via stdio (JSON-RPC 2.0). After adding, click "Reload MCP tools" under Tools.
mcp.envPlaceholder:
Environment variables (optional, one per line):
FIRECRAWL_API_KEY=fc-xxx
OTHER_VAR=value
mcp.marketplaceHint: Find MCP servers on various marketplaces, e.g.

telegram.allowedUsers: Allowed users (one username per line, without @)
telegram.allowedUsersHelp: Only these Telegram usernames may send messages

firstRun.option1De: OpenRouter API Key (empfohlen) â€” viele Modelle, einfache Einrichtung
firstRun.option1En: OpenRouter API Key (recommended) â€” many models, easy setup
firstRun.option2De: Ollama â€” lokal auf deinem Rechner / Server
firstRun.option2En: Ollama â€” running locally on your machine / server
